creditline: Gift of the Karen Lennox Gallery, Chicago
description: primitive painting with four horizontal rows of imagery; bright colors, white ground; "1909" at left edge in black, ULQ; "1902", in black, and "1903", in blue in URQ; "1904", "1909" and "1911" at bottom edge near center in yellow; image of standing bearded man (Jesus?) in URC wearing green garments, with pants tucked into short boots, holding a yellow loop of rope encircling 12 heads of bearded men (the disciples?); small female figure with very long blonde hair at top center, wearing white and green; kneeling figure with Star of David on waist sash pointing at two goats at right edge above center; brown and blue rocket at center right; lower section has two very tall female figures in LLQ--one with long dark hair, one with long blonde hair, accompanying two shorter women with dark hair in a braid, each wearing a long cape; three trees at bottom; flames in LLQ; white frame
image_copyright: Copyright of the artist%2C artist%27s estate%2C or assignees
medium: Oil and mixed media on canvas
